page.title: 12THE EXETER UNDERCOVER MARKET
page.content: The Market is situated at the junction of Fore Street and Market Street. It is underneath St. Georges Hall. It is owned by Exeter City Council. It cost approximately Â£28 a week to rent a stall. The markets busiest day is Saturday. The market is not as busy today as it was 10 years ago. More old people use the market than young people. The Commerative Stone was laid by The Right Worshipful The Mayor of Exeter, Alderman Charles Woodland, chairman of the market and general purposes committee on the 25th of April, 1960. In the Market there are these stalls: clothes, meat, fish, dairy, toys, vegetables, sweets, baker, books, grocery, cards, pet shop, cafe, antiques, jewellery bags, flowers, stamps,and wool.
